definition: n. 恋物（等于fetich）；迷信；偶像
a form of sexual desire in which gratification depends to an abnormal degree on some object or item of clothing or part of the body
a charm superstitiously believed to embody magical powers
excessive or irrational devotion to some activity

english-chinese.definition: N-COUNT If someone has a fetish, they have an unusually strong liking or need for a particular object or activity, as a way of getting sexual pleasure. 恋物癖
N-COUNT If you say that someone has a fetish for doing something, you disapprove of the fact that they do it very often or enjoy it very much. 迷恋表不满
sentences: What began as a postwar fetish for sunbathing is rapidly developing into a world health crisis.
始于战后对日光浴的迷恋快速发展成世界健康危机。

english-chinese.definition: N-COUNT In some cultures, a fetish is an object, especially a carved object, which is considered to have religious importance or magical powers. 宗教木雕

definition: n. 敌人；反对者；危害物
an armed adversary (especially a member of an opposing military force)

english-chinese.definition: N-COUNT Someone's foe is their enemy. 敌人
sentences: But he soon discovers that his old foe may be leading him into a trap.
但他不久发现他的老对头也许正把他引入圈套。

definition: payment made to a person in a position of trust to corrupt his judgment
make illegal payments to in exchange for favors or influence

english-chinese.definition: N-COUNT A bribe is a sum of money or something valuable that one person offers or gives to another in order to persuade him or her to do something. 贿赂
sentences: He was being investigated for receiving bribes.
他那时因为接收贿赂在受到调查。

english-chinese.definition: V-T If one person bribes another, they give them a bribe. 贿赂
sentences: He was accused of bribing a senior bank official.
他被控贿赂一位银行高级职员。
